intro: Viola cuspidifolia, commonly known as the spear-leaved violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with sharp, pointed tips and clusters of small, delicate purple or violet flowers. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with its flowering period occurring in spring. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
